title: Step Eight
subtitle: We made a list of all persons we had harmed and became willing to make amends to them all.

questions.prompt: Who belongs on my Eighth Step list?
Whom have I harmed?
What is the nature of the wrongs I've committed against this person?
What effect has my behavior had on this person?
In making my list, is my sponsor helping me see where I've harmed others?
Have I included myself on my list? Why or why not?
What have I done to harm myself?
Am I willing to make amends to myself? How?
Is my list complete?
Have I looked at each of my relationships for the harm that I have done?
Do I have a nagging feeling that I've forgotten someone? Who?
Am I blaming others instead of looking honestly at the harm I've caused?
Am I avoiding putting someone on my list because they also harmed me?
Have I taken full responsibility for my actions?
Am I willing to make amends to those I've harmed?
Am I resistant to the idea of approaching certain people? Why?
What might be the results of making these amends?
What might be the results of not making these amends?
How is my willingness to make amends connected to my spiritual condition?
What does it mean to make amends?
Do I understand the difference between making amends and simply apologizing?
What actions will I need to take to make amends?
Am I willing to go to any lengths to make amends?
Is there anyone I'm not willing to make amends to? Why?
What will I do to become willing to make amends to everyone on my list?
How am I practicing self-honesty in making my list?
How am I practicing open-mindedness in becoming willing?
How does willingness change my attitude toward making amends?
How does working this step require me to practice humility?
How complete is my list?
How willing am I to make amends?
What barriers do I still have to making amends? How can I remove them?
